title: Eroded serif and clean script
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826031652im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Rocketj_Logo_5308.jpg)

Trying to identify both of these fonts; the eroded serif and the clean elegant sans script.

Thanks!

Font: 

 Famous Label and Stamp Act 

Solved By: 

 [Mike F](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826031652/http:/typophile.com/user/3368 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Rocketj\_Logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826031652/http:/typophile.com/files/Rocketj_Logo.jpg) | 31.29 KB |
author: rocketjnyc

comments.content: The script is Harold Lohner's splendid [Famous Label](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826031652/http:/haroldsfonts.com/portfolio/famous-label/).

The serif is **[Stamp Act](http://web.archive.org/web/20140826031652/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Dafont-2&ffam=Stamp%20Act%20-%20Regular&fid=5f0fc2f357e0a3aca7e5c3ee7600c59d&fstyle=i&fsize=48&text=Rocket%20J%20%26%20the%2088's&wrap=2)** by Harold Lohner [1998].  
The text set is "Rocket J & the 88's" (note that capital & lower case contain different capital glyphs)
Thanks very much Mike F and fvilanakis!
